TheWord.ScriptureReference: Matthew 21:19, Mark 11:14, Luke 6:44, John 18:36, Deuteronomy 21:23, Job 19:26, Daniel 5:21
TheWord.Title: He has to bring His own body together with God. To have loved Me, is to have loved Yourself. Kowe si ile. Fight time.
TheWord.Commentary: He has to bring His own body together with God, AlphabetSequence 444. Bernard Lewis: The Crisis of Islam Holy War and Unholy Terror ISBN 0-7862-5734-2 page 127 1979-11-04T00:00:00.0000000-08:00 ... 1981-01-20T00:00:00.0000000-08:00, 444 days, United States Embassy in Tehran was seized and 62 Americans taken hostage, page 144 sideline stages.

Prophet.Commentary: And When He saw a fig tree in the way, He came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on the henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away (Matthew 21:19). And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever. And His disciples heard it (Mark 11:14). For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes (Luke 6:44). Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if My kingdom were of this world, then would My servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is My kingdom not from hence (John 18:36).

AlphabetSequence.Commentary: Wake-up Orientation: Right hand holding the left elbow, left hand knuckles the right elbow, right feet on top and extending farther than the left feet, left knee extending farther.

AlphabetSequence.Word: To have loved Me, is to have loved Yourself.
AlphabetSequence.Commentary: Naked. Wake-up Orientation: Knees upright, hands bowed at the elbows.
Feets crossed. Bed sheets rolls towards the backyard. Shower.
